0.text:
Cathy Wurzer: It’s been a long campaign,
it’s almost over, but not before we hear

3.text:
from the candidates in one final debate of
the 2014 election season in Minnesota. This

9.text:
one pits incumbent U.S. Democratic Senator
Al Franken, who’s finishing up his first

12.text:
term, against the Republican challenger, political
newcomer and businessman Mike McFadden. I’m

17.text:
Cathy Wurzer, the host of Morning Edition
on Minnesota Public Radio News, along with

20.text: Kerri Miller from the Daily Circuit.

22.text:
Kerri Miller: Hello there, welcome everyone.
I’ve always liked the way that Supreme Court

27.text:
Justice Louis Brandeis thought about polit
political voting and the roles that voters

33.text:
play in politics. He said, “The most important
political office is that of the private citizen.”

40.text:
In other words, your vote counts. Our goal
tonight, is to speed you on your way to that

45.text:
vote, with important information and more
information about these candidates for the

50.text:
U.S. Senate. So shall we begin? Welcome everyone,
good to have you here.

58.text:
CW: Glad you’re with us. Thanks to the candidates,
glad you’re here.

62.text:

has been characterized by many as a time in

69.text:

as a comedian and you’ve played it safe.

81.text:

like to see him take more risk.” So the

87.text:
question is, if you’re constantly playing
it safe, are you really making a difference?

sexually assaulted ah by ah military contractors.

which there was mandatory arbitration. So

up and said “This is wrong. These women

And I had actually the Defense Department

136.text:

against me. I had ah 30 Republicans, ah my

against me. On this. But I won.
